intro: Rhodanthe diffusa, commonly known as the golden rhipsalis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Rhodanthe diffusa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
